preview.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an occasion when you can see a film, play, painting etc before it is shown to the public
preview.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the press preview of the show  (=when people who write for newspapers, television etc could see it)
a sneak preview of the new fashions for autumn
preview.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a description of a film, television programme, show etc that people will be able to see soon
preview.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to see or describe something before it is shown to the public
preview.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Journalists will be able to preview the exhibition tomorrow.
preview.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to show or perform something before it is shown to the public
preview.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The band will preview their new album on 2nd March.
preview.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an occasion when you see a product, film, record etc, before it is made generally available to the public
preview.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Today we can give you a preview of the new Nikon professional digital camera.
